meanings.definition: To provide a gloss or explanation for a text.
meanings.sent1: She glossed over the difficult parts of the story to make it easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: The teacher glossed the unfamiliar words in the book for the students.
meanings.sent3: He glossed the assignment with colorful notes to make it more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The politician glossed his speech with promises he couldn't keep.
meanings.sent5: The expert glossed the complex topic with simple examples for the audience.

meanings.definition: To make something shiny or smooth by rubbing it.
meanings.sent1: She glossed the table with polish to make it sparkle.
meanings.sent2: The car was glossed to perfection by the car wash attendant.
meanings.sent3: He glossed the shoes until they gleamed like new.
meanings.sent4: The artist glossed the painting with a final coat of varnish.
meanings.sent5: The mother glossed the mirror until it reflected like glass.

meanings.definition: To give a deceptively attractive appearance to something.
meanings.sent1: The company glossed the product packaging to make it look more appealing.
meanings.sent2: She glossed her resume to make her experience seem better than it was.
meanings.sent3: He glossed the truth to avoid getting into trouble.
meanings.sent4: The real estate agent glossed the flaws of the house during the tour.
meanings.sent5: The magazine cover was glossed to attract more readers.
